intro: Bonnaya sanpabloensis, commonly known as San Pablo's bonnaya, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, clustered growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elongated, fibrous fruits. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
